title.bibl: Saloniki, Dec. 18, 1920. Performance of a Greek Comedy

div.bibl: Saloniki, Dec. 18, 1920. PERFORMANCE OF A GREEK COMEDY

body.p: Last Sunday night the performance of the comedy "Tziotiko Ravaisi" took place in the beautiful Aryan Grotto Theatre. It was given by the Vappa dramatic group.
Before the performance, Mrs. E. Stamos and Mr. I. Kouyarakos sang a beautiful Spanish duet and danced a Spanish dance with great skill and accomplishment.
"Tziotiko Ravaisi" by Tinov Depastas, is undoubtedly the best comedy of the newer Greek theater. The setting is rustic and the play unfolds very naturally.

Mrs. A. Stamatogiannis played the lead and danced a comical dance with the historical Rokan, with great finesse. Mr. C. Kokkinis and Mr. G. Stamatogiannis
portrayed their parts with extreme success. The latter has a remarkable resemblance in his walk and appearance to the well-known Charlie Chaplin.
Mr. K. Vappas took the part of a buffoon and was heartily applauded.
In general the performance surpassed the expectations of the public, which was very enthusiastic.
